components.description:
A domestic cat, beloved as a pet. Generally depicted as a light-orange cat with stripes, as a tabby, in full profile on all fours facing left, with its long tell held upright.

See also üê± Cat Face.

Google’s cat is cartoon-styled, shown sitting on its hind legs with a friendly expression and whiskers. Facebook’s cat is a gray tabby, though previously was orange. Microsoft and Samsung’s cats were previously gray, Twitter’s brown.
components.title: Cat

See also üê± Cat Face.

Google’s cat is cartoon-styled, shown sitting on its hind legs with a friendly expression and whiskers. Facebook’s cat is a gray tabby, though previously was orange. Microsoft and Samsung’s cats were previously gray, Twitter’s brown.
title: Cat

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A domestic house cat, shown facing left-of-screen on all major platforms. Distinct from the cat face emoji, this cat emoji shows the full bo http://emojipedia.org/cat/
emoji_net_data.name: cat

bn:00090742v: Of a cat, to make its cry.

bn:00090604v: Indicate pleasure by purring; characteristic of cats

bn:00015267n: The domestic dog is a canid that is known as man's best friend.
The dog is a mammal in the order Carnivora.
A common four-legged animal, especially kept by people as a pet or to hunt or guard things.
Subspecies of the Canid√¶ family, frequently kept as a pet
A member of the genus Canis (probably descended from the common wolf) that has been domesticated by man since prehistoric times; occurs in many breeds
The quality of being a dog.

bn:00054399n: Cat communication is the transfer of information by one or more cats that has an effect on the current or future behavior of another animal, including humans.
The sound made by a cat (or any sound resembling this)
The act of producing a mew sound.
Meow, also known as Meow the fat cat, was a male domestic cat who attracted international attention due to the effort to slim him down.

bn:00061787n: Animal kept for companionship and a person's enjoyment

A pet is an animal kept primarily for a person's company or protection, as opposed to working animals, sport animals, livestock, and laboratory animals, which are kept primarily for performance, agricultural value, or research.
An animal which is kept in the home as a companion and treated affectionately.
An animal kept as a companion.
A domesticated animal kept for companionship or amusement

bn:00016606n: An affectionate term for a cat.
The domestic cat is a small, usually furry, domesticated, and carnivorous mammal.
A common four-legged animal (Felis silvestris) that is often kept as a household pet.
This entry is about the animal.
Affectionate term for a girl or woman.
A small, usually furry, domesticated, carnivorous mammal
A domesticated cat, of the species Felis silvestris catus (commonly called Felis domesticus), especially one kept as a pet.
A cat that is hold as a pet.
Feline mammal usually having thick soft fur and no ability to roar: domestic cats; wildcats
A pet name for a cat.
A domesticated subspecies (Felis silvestris catus) of feline animal, commonly kept as a house pet.
